sentences.en: Cats were domesticated by the Egyptians.
Cattle were first domesticated in Neolithic times.
sentences.cn: 新石器时代有人开始驯养牛.

sentences.en: Cows were domesticated to provide us with milk.
sentences.cn: 人们饲养奶牛来为我们提供牛奶.

sentences.en: He is thoroughly domesticated and cooks a delicious chicken casserole.
sentences.cn: 他精于家务,烹制的砂锅炖小鸡非常可口.

sentences.en: He's become a lot more domesticated since his marriage.
Horizontal resistance, being variable in the wild state, can be domesticated.
sentences.cn: 水平抗性在野生状态下是可变的, 它可以驯化.

sentences.en: I'm domesticated now . Two children . And Don is putting on weight.
sentences.cn: 我现在是家务缠身啦,有了两个孩子啦,塘思现在可发福啦.

sentences.en: In many systems of permanent subsistence agriculture, domesticated animals play an important role.
sentences.cn: 在许多固定的自给农业系统中, 家畜起着重要的作用.

sentences.en: In spite of her efforts, Hunt had not quite domesticated.
sentences.cn: 虽然她想尽了办法, 亨特仍不常在家住.
妈妈不是很喜欢干家务活。

sentences.en: Mustang is a wild horse, not a domesticated racer.
sentences.cn: 野马是野性的马, 不是已驯化的赛马.

sentences.en: No, like many birds in the city it is very much domesticated.
sentences.cn: 不会的, 跟许多城市里的鸟一样,它也被很好的驯化了.

sentences.en: Ray’s very domesticated and even likes baking cakes.
sentences.cn: 雷很喜欢做家务，他甚至爱烤蛋糕。

sentences.en: The domesticated cat retains its predatory instincts.
sentences.cn: 猫依然保持着捕食动物的天性.

sentences.en: We domesticated the dog to help us with hunting.
sentences.cn: 我们驯狗来帮我们打猎。

words.tran_cn: 国内的；家庭的；驯养的；一心只管家务的
国内地；家庭式地；适合国内地
家庭生活；专心于家务；对家庭的挚爱
驯养；使习惯于或喜爱家务和家庭生活
家养的；驯服的；喜欢家庭生活的

trans.tran_cn: 喜欢家庭生活的，（指动物）被驯养了的
trans.tran_en: domesticated animals are able to work for people or live with them as pets

trans.tran_cn: 驯化( domesticate的过去式和过去分词 )
